intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: Brown professor and anthropologist Ieva Jusionyte was recently awarded a MacArthur grant worth how much?
questions.explanation: On Oct. 8, the MacArthur Foundation named Ieva Jusionyte a 2025 MacArthur Fellow — an $800,000 grant recognizing extraordinary creativity.

questions.question: On Tuesday, the Brown Undergraduate Council of Students announced a referendum concerning what topic?
choices: A vote of no confidence in the board of student organizations
questions.explanation: UCS announced a referendum on whether Brown should accept or reject the federal Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education.

questions.question: How many Brown students took an entrepreneurship course last year?
questions.explanation: Over 1,664 students enrolled in entrepreneurship courses last year, a 20% increase, with the Nelson Center cited as a driver.

questions.question: When was the S/NC grading system established at Brown?
questions.explanation: The S/NC option was implemented with the Open Curriculum in 1969 to encourage exploration and academic risk-taking.

questions.question: At least how many departments have had their Ph.D admissions paused for the 2026-27 academic year?
questions.explanation: Leaders of at least six departments were told their Ph.D. program admissions would be paused for 2026–27 amid budget cuts.

questions.question: How many miles did students walk in the “Walk Across Rhode Island” event on Oct. 12?
questions.explanation: Nearly 200 students walked 30 miles in 12 hours, raising over $4,000 for malaria prevention.

questions.question: When did the Korean Language Program’s celebration of Hangeul, the Korean alphabet, begin?
questions.explanation: The celebration began Sept. 29, featuring a Hangeul Truck translating English messages into Korean and other events.

questions.question: In what field did Professor Peter Howitt win the Nobel Prize?
questions.explanation: Professor Emeritus Peter Howitt won the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences for work on growth via creative destruction.

questions.question: Axel Brito ’26 is running for Providence City Council as a member of what political party?
questions.explanation: Brito is running as a Republican in the Ward 2 special election to fill a vacated City Council seat.

questions.question: When was the last time Brown football defeated both URI and Bryant in the same year?
questions.explanation: With wins over URI and Bryant, Brown achieved a feat they hadn’t accomplished in the preceding seven years.
